claim.text: Lyfe Agents combine low computational cost with real-time responsiveness while remaining intelligent and goal-oriented
claim.exact_quote: They combine low-cost with real-time responsiveness, all while remaining intelligent and goal-oriented.

conclusion.limitations: No direct evidence provided in paper for real-time responsiveness or intelligence metrics

claim.text: Lyfe Agents operate at 10-100 times lower computational cost than existing alternatives
claim.exact_quote: our techniques enabled Lyfe Agents to operate at a computational cost 10-100 times lower than existing alternatives

conclusion.limitations: No detailed cost comparison data presented for existing alternatives

claim.text: The developed agents cost about 30-100 times less than Park et al. (2023)'s approach
claim.exact_quote: we developed agents that cost about 30-100 times less than that of Park et al. (2023)

evidence.limitations: Cost estimation of Park et al. (2023) is based on appendix calculation, not direct comparison
evidence.exact_quote: Lyfe Agents achieve a rather low cost of 0.5 US dollar per agent per human hour (Fig. 6)

conclusion.limitations: Single comparison point, methodology for cost calculation not fully detailed

claim.text: Agents using basic architecture exited conversations three times faster than Lyfe Agents equipped with option-action selection
claim.exact_quote: we found that agents using the above basic architecture exited conversations three times faster than Lyfe Agents equipped with option-action selection

evidence.evidence_text: Conversation length comparison between Lyfe Agents and ablated agents
evidence.exact_quote: the average conversation length...is 70.348 ± 13.189 seconds (n = 9) for Lyfe Agents and 23.802 ± 1.463 seconds (n = 4) for ablated agents

conclusion.limitations: Limited sample size (n=9 vs n=4), single scenario test

claim.text: The agents were able to identify Francesco as the primary suspect over 60% of the time within 15 minutes of agent-agent interactions
claim.exact_quote: Within just 15 minutes of agent-agent interactions, the police officer agent was able to identify Francesco as the primary suspect over 60% of the time, even in the most challeging 9-agent setting

evidence.evidence_text: Success rate in murder mystery scenario
evidence.exact_quote: Within just 15 minutes of agent-agent interactions, the police officer agent was able to identify Francesco as the primary suspect over 60% of the time

conclusion.limitations: Success rate varies significantly with number of agents, specific scenario conditions

claim.text: Lyfe Agents achieve a cost of 0.5 US dollar per agent per human hour
claim.exact_quote: Lyfe Agents achieve a rather low cost of 0.5 US dollar per agent per human hour

evidence.evidence_text: Cost per agent shown in Figure 6
evidence.limitations: Details of cost calculation in appendix
evidence.exact_quote: Lyfe Agents achieve a rather low cost of 0.5 US dollar per agent per human hour

conclusion.limitations: Cost calculation methodology not fully explained, may vary with usage patterns

claim.text: Without self-monitoring or Summarize-and-Forget memory, performance dramatically lowers
claim.exact_quote: Whereas ablating either self-monitoring or Summarize-and-Forget (SaF) memory dramatically lowers the performance

evidence.exact_quote: ablating either self-monitoring or Summarize-and-Forget (SaF) memory dramatically lowers the performance

conclusion.limitations: Ablation results shown primarily for murder mystery scenario, may not generalize to all tasks
